messageBody:
Hello,

I have randomized JUnit 3 tests that look like the following:

public class Test1 extends TestCase {

public static TestSuite suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite ("name of the test suite");
for (int i = 0; i < 1000; i++)
suite.addTest(new Test1());
return suite;
}

public Test1() {
super("testMethod");
}

protected void setUp() {
// create random (meaningful) inputs to the functionality under test
}

protected void tearDown() {
// set everything to null
}

public void testMethod() {
// run the test
}
}

Then I organize my test suites into a LARGE hierarchy (of depth possibly larger than 8; only 3 in this simple example):

public class AllTests {

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite ("name of the test suite");
suite.addTest(Test1.suite());
suite.addTest(Test2.suite());
// etc.
}
}

In fact, it ends up being so large (over 150,000 tests) that JUnit cannot cope with it and runs out of memory (even though you will notice I have taken care of systematically nulling everything in tearDown()).

How can I get this done without running out of memory? I have looked a bit at JUnit 4's new paradigm using annotations, but haven't been able to figure out how to set up such tests.

Thanks in advance for your suggestions.
